dojg.description: A structure which expresses the idea that a certain amount of something is sufficient to do something.
dojg.meaning: Be enough to/for; if ~ at least; if ~ as much/many as ~, it will be enough to

examples.japanese: (ks).この美術館は三時間もあれば全部見られる。
examples.english: Three  hours are enough to see everything in this art museum. (literally: If you have  as many as three hours, you can see everything in this art museum.)

examples.japanese: (a).二万円も持って行けば足りるでしょう。
examples.english: 20,000  yen will probably be enough. (literally: If you take as much as 20,000 yen with  you, it will probably be sufficient.)

examples.japanese: (b).ビールは二ダースも買っておけば大丈夫だ。
examples.english: As  for beer, if we buy two dozen, it will be enough (literally: we will be all right).

examples.japanese: (c).一週間もすれば歩けるようになります。
examples.english: It  will take no more than a week until you can walk (literally: until you become  able to walk).

examples.japanese: (d).二、三回も聞けば大体分かる。
examples.english: Listening  two or three times is/will be sufficient for understanding most of it.
